title: Remove Grievous Wounds From Morellonomicon and Make A New AP Item With It
body:
* For starters, it's not fair for AP champions that they can only inflict Grievous Wounds at a certain percent of the enemies health, while AD champions are capable of doing it at any health percent.
* Morellonomicon is already a very gold efficient item, even without TWO of its passives. Morellos is simply an overloaded item, and as such it makes sense to remove the Grievous Wounds seeing how they do not fit the item's "AP caster" theme anyway.
* While I do not really agree that AP champions are lacking items, I do believe most of them are too niche oriented which makes them less viable on some champions compared to others. Due to this, it doesn't hurt to add another AP item to the mix, with its own specific niche (reduced healing).

My own personal idea? Create something like this:


> 
Void Grimoire
--
+80 AP
--
Unique Passive - Eyes of Pain: +15 Magic Penetration
Unique Passive - Executioner: Dealing Magical Damage inflicts Grievous Wounds on enemy champions for 5 seconds.
Unique Passive - Giant Slayer: Grants up to +20% Magical Damage against enemy champions with greater maximum Heath than you.

This may not be a perfect solution, but I think it's definitely a good start for evening out the missing links between AP and AD items and solving the Grievous Wound problem for AP champions.

There are a few healing sources:

* Innate combat abilities.
* Innate out of combat abilities.
* Lifesteal (items)
* External out of combat healing. (think warmogs)

I think we can do without grievous wounds.

An innate ability can easily be nerfed when overbearing.
A problem arises when you have abilities that can be used both in and out of combat.
The main healing we are trying (or should I say 'able') to prevent with GR is in-combat sustain/healing. 
Out of combat is often not the problem (and shouldn't be too low), but if the equal amount is healed in combat it feels too overbearing, resulting in a need for an item against support champions. This can be fixed innately by adding an exception for example: "healing is halved when used on allies in combat with enemy champions."

Another problem arises when champions get ahead or increase the healing they get in an uncontrolled manner.
Stacking lifesteal items, Ap (for healing scaling with AP) or Health (for healing scaling with health) may increase the healing in such a way that skew the balance.
Those lifesteal items must have a clear disadvantage and the scaling should be controlled via less snowball dependant stats like level.

AD have GV on hit because, example, Mundo. If you place a restriction on that GV to 40% on an ADC, they're never going to reach that point due to Mundo's healing. For an ADC, that effect needs to be instant, in order for it to accomplish it's goal. 

For mages, who target squishier targets, they often have more range, more aoe, etc, they're naturally doing lots of damage instantly, so it's plausible that they'll hit that 40% easily, within a reasonable time frame for it to be able to take effect.
